actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:30 a.m. on February 26, 2026.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Green, Al (TX) moved that the House do now adjourn.

actions-list.header: Inspector General of the House of Representatives
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to clause 6 of Rule II, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker, Majority Leader, and Minority Leader jointly appointed Ms. Christen Stevenson, Brandywine, Maryland.

Mr. Kiley (CA), asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:30 a.m. on Thursday, February 26, 2026; and that when the House adjourns on that day, it adjourn to meet at 9 a.m. on Monday, March 2, 2026; and when it adjourns on that day, it adjourn to meet at noon on Tuesday, March 3, 2026, for Morning-Hour debate and 2 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the recent shooting in Pawtucket, Rhode Island.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 210
actions-list.actionItem: 199, 1 Present (Roll no. 78).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 198
actions-list.actionItem: 208 (Roll no. 77).
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Castor (FL) moved to recommit to the Committee on Energy and Commerce.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 4758.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4626 and H.R. 4758. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4626 and H.R. 4758 under a closed rule with one motion to recommit for each bill. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate on each bill.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1075. H.R. 4758 â€” "To repeal provisions of Public Law 117-169 relating to taxpayer subsidies for home electrification, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Williams of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
